page.title: 02Employment
page.content: Approximately 11% of the working age population is unemployed. The national average is 13%. There are industrial estates for small time employers but no large industries. Small factories have employees making furniture, clocks and specialised road vehicle trailers. A small maltings prepares grain for the brewing industry. There are many small businesses employing one or two people and many self employed people offering their services doing house repairs and gardening. National and local government have offices employing a few people. One office is concerned with registering people seeking employment and listing job vacancies. Many employees are members of a relevant trade union and meet to negotiate pay awards and working conditions.
